Class Envelope

java.lang.Object
common.Envelope
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Envelope extends Object implements Serializable
A generic network wrapper used for all client-server communication.

Envelope standardizes the structure of messages exchanged between the client and the server. Every request and response is wrapped inside an Envelope, allowing consistent handling, logging, and validation.

The payload field may contain:

  • A single DTO
  • A list of DTOs
  • A primitive wrapper or String

depending on the OpCode.

Each envelope is automatically assigned a unique request ID and timestamp upon creation, which can be used to match responses to requests.

See Also:
  • Serialized Form
